title: font suggestion for high end shaving kits
content:
The product is called bull’s eye and the logo is an archer (attached) and the name of the company is bull’s eye shaving products.

I wish the face to express quality and precision.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202200246/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_88.png) | 6.88 KB |

 [‹ Flowing multiple text files in parallel throughout a document](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202200246/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37064 "Go to previous forum topic") [script typeface suitable for display needed ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202200246/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37092 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Juggling man

comments.content: Is this high-end electric razors, high-end creams and lotions, straightrazors?

My thoughts: either something geometric (circular o’s reflecting the bullseye) or something straight and sans-y. In that vein, try Hypatia Pro (available if you register for the new Adobe Creative Suite, but otherwise, I’m not sure), [Klavika](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202200246/http:/processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/klavika/index.html), [Camingo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202200246/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jan-fromm/camingo/), [Verlag](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202200246/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100009), and [Avenir Next](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202200246/http:/www.linotype.com/90672/avenirnext-family.html). I would think of more, but it’s late where I am and sleep beckons.

Not to mention ...

The Luxury collection from House

Sackers Gothic

Mercury from H&FJ

Didot from H&FJ
